title: 820-3787: One Beep Code
message:
Hello

Have a 820-3787 with one beep code for no ram installed. Are there other issues that could cause this failure and not the ram.

Customer claims it originally had issues with the track pad, so he/she replaced it with another trackpad which is when the beep started. They Reinstalled the original trackpad with the same beep code. I hooked up the medusa and it says the VSS PRAM block not found. Could this be the issue, that its just a corrupted bios chip? 

FYI: fan does spin.

title: 820-3787: One Beep Code
message:
Try new BIOS first.
Also check for knocked off components...

title: 820-3787: One Beep Code
message:
Hello

Can you assist with a clean bios file, don't seem to have any donor board for this model.
THanks.

title: 820-3787: One Beep Code
message:
Try this as is, just for test.
Supposed to be clean ME, no idea if it is...
[url]https://drive.google.com/open?id=1TiQAXEFpoDdoG5UwlT-WfHpudY_ajVBB[/url]
If still bad, upload your BIOS.
Don't forget to make backup first!!!

title: 820-3787: One Beep Code
message:
Hello, 
same issue with the bios file. Here's link for the bios from this board.

[url]https://drive.google.com/open?id=1udIDoMAHOAP0elITX1fJjOjyL0bjNjJ2[/url]

Thanks.

title: 820-3787: One Beep Code
message: Could you clean ME region with Medusa?

title: 820-3787: One Beep Code
message: It fails every time I try to do it on the logic board. I?ve ordered the adapter for the Medusa so that I can solder the chip on it and do it off the logic board.

title: 820-3787: One Beep Code
message: Ok finally received the board, pulled the efi chip, and then cleaned the ME region with MedUSA. Still having the same single beep code.

title: 820-3787: One Beep Code
message:
Disconnect RIO board and other perypherals.
Keep only LCD connected.
Try even without LCD, external video through Thunderbolt adapter.
Investigate PCH SMBUS...

title: 820-3787: One Beep Code
message:
PCH SMBUS signals matched with another known good board. 

Apart from no data being transmitted from and to the RAM's, the only other measurements i found that was different was the MEM_B_CLK which is reading at 580mv while all the other boards i tested were measuring at 640mv. Source for this signal is from the cpu.

title: 820-3787: One Beep Code
message: Yeah that?s my conclusion. Thanks for the assistance.

title: 820-3787: One Beep Code
message:
I had one last month with the same symptom.
It happened after LCD changing.
God knows what they f***d on the board.

title: 820-3787: One Beep Code
message: My assumption is they did the swap with either power still plugged on had damaged the cable causing a short or bridged a line.
